info.title: Veeam Backup & Replication REST API
info.description:
This document lists paths (endpoints) of the Veeam Backup & Replication REST API and operations that you can perform by sending HTTP requests to the paths.
Requests can contain parameters in their path, query and header. POST and PUT requests can include a request body with resource payload. In response, you receive a conventional HTTP response code, HTTP response header and an optional response body schema that contains a result model.
Some request and response bodies refer to reusable schema objects that are defined in the `schemas` section of the REST API specification. Schemas, in turn, may inherit a part of their properties by referring to other schemas, and be polymorphic by referring to multiple alternate schemas.

tags.name: Login
tags.description:
The authorization process involves obtaining an access token and a refresh token.
For details on the authorization process and security settings, see [Authorization and Security](https://helpcenter.veeam.com/docs/backup/vbr_rest/authorization_security.html?ver=120).

tags.name: Service
tags.description: The Service section defines paths and operations for retrieving information about the backup server where the REST API service is running.

tags.name: Services
tags.description: The Services section defines a path and operation for retrieving information about associated backend services. You may need to connect to these services for integration with Veeam Backup & Replication.

tags.name: Credentials
tags.description: The Credentials section defines paths and operations for managing credentials records that are added to the backup server.

tags.name: Encryption
tags.description: The Encryption section defines paths and operations for managing passwords that are used for data encryption.

tags.name: Connection
tags.description: The Connection section defines a path and operation for retrieving a TLS certificate or SSH fingerprint used to establish a secure connection between the backup server and the specified server.

tags.name: Cloud Browser
tags.description: The Cloud Browser section defines paths and operations for retrieving information about cloud resources (compute or storage). Cloud browser helps you map a cloud folder with an object storage repository.

tags.name: Inventory Browser
tags.description:
The Inventory Browser section defines paths and operations for retrieving VMware vSphere servers and their virtual infrastructure objects (data centers, clusters, hosts, resource pools, VMs).
NOTE
In the current version, you can browse VMware vSphere objects only.

tags.name: Traffic Rules
tags.description: The Traffic Rules section defines paths and operations for retrieving and editing information about network traffic rules that are configured on the backup server.

tags.name: General Options
tags.description:
The General Options section defines paths and operations for retrieving and editing general settings of Veeam Backup & Replication.
NOTE
In the current version of the REST API, you can configure notification settings only.

tags.name: Configuration Backup
tags.description: The Configuration Backup section defines paths and operations for managing backup of the configuration database that Veeam Backup & Replication uses.

tags.name: Managed Servers
tags.description:
The Managed Servers section defines paths and operations for managing servers.
NOTE
In the current version, the REST API supports the following server types: *VMware vSphere*, *Linux* and *Windows*.

tags.name: Repositories
tags.description:
The Repositories section defines paths and operations for managing backup repositories.
NOTE
In the current version, the REST API supports the following storage types: direct attached storages (Microsoft Windows and Linux servers), network attached storages (SMB and NFS shares) and object storages. For details on how to add an object storage repository, see [Adding Object Storage Repository](https://helpcenter.veeam.com/docs/backup/vbr_rest/object_storage.html?ver=120).

tags.name: Proxies
tags.description:
The Proxies section defines paths and operations for managing backup proxies.
NOTE
In the current version, the REST API supports VMware backup proxies only.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description:
The Jobs section defines paths and operations for managing jobs that are coordinated by the backup server.
NOTE
In the current version, the REST API supports only jobs of the *Backup* type that include only VMware vSphere objects of the following types: *VirtualMachine*, *vCenterServer*, *Datacenter*, *Cluster*, *Host*, *ResourcePool*, *Folder*, *Template*, *Tag*, *Datastore* and *DatastoreCluster*. Objects with tags combination (or *Multitag*) are not supported.

tags.name: Backups
tags.description: The Backups section defines paths and operations for managing backups that are created on or imported to the backup server.

tags.name: Backup Objects
tags.description: The Backup Objects section defines paths and operations for managing backup objects — virtual infrastructure objects (VMs and VM containers) that are included in backups created by the backup server.

tags.name: Object Restore Points
tags.description: The Object Restore Points section defines paths and operations for retrieving restore points created on the backup server and backed up disks from the restore points.

tags.name: Restore
tags.description:
The Restore section defines paths and operations for performing restore.
NOTE
In the current version, the REST API supports the following recovery operations:
  • Instant Recovery of a VMware vSphere VM to VMware vSphere
  • Entire VM restore of a VMware vSphere VM to VMware vSphere
  • Restore of disks that will be registered as First Class Disks (FCD) — a type of virtual disks that can be managed independent of any VM.

tags.name: Sessions
tags.description: The Sessions section defines paths and operations for managing sessions (except [automation sessions](#tag/Automation/operation/GetAllAutomationSessions)) performed on the backup server.

tags.name: Agents
tags.description: The Agents section defines paths and operations for managing recovery tokens used for bare metal recovery.

tags.name: Automation
tags.description: The Automation section defines paths and operations for granular import and export of objects available in the REST API. It can be useful, for example, if you set up the backup infrastructure using JSON specification or migrate the infrastructure to another backup server. For details, see [Mass Deployment](https://helpcenter.veeam.com/docs/backup/vbr_rest/automation.html?ver=120).

get.description: The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/serverTime` path allows you to get current date and time on the backup server.
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/serverCertificate` path allows you to get a certificate of the backup server.

The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/serverInfo` path allows you to get Veeam Backup & Replication installation ID, backup server name (or IP address), build number and cumulative patches installed on the backup server.
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/services` path allows you to get associated services for integration with Veeam Backup & Replication.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of services to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of services to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts services by one of the service parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: Sorts services in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters services by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any service parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

post.description: The HTTP POST request to the `/api/oauth2/token` path allows you to get an access token and a refresh token.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/oauth2/authorization_code` path allows you to get an authorization code that is used to obtain an access token. For more information on authorization process, see [Requesting Authorization](https://helpcenter.veeam.com/docs/backup/vbr_rest/requesting_authorization.html?ver=120).
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/oauth2/logout` path allows you to perform the logout operation. After you log out, your access and refresh tokens are expired.

get.description: The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/trafficRules` path allows you to get network traffic rules that control traffic transferred between backup infrastructure components.

put.description: The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/trafficRules` path allows you to edit network traffic rules that are configured on the backup server.

201.description: Infrastructure session has been created to edit the traffic rules. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description: The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions` path allows you to get notification settings of Veeam Backup & Replication.

put.description: The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions` path allows you to edit notification settings of Veeam Backup & Replication.

get.description: The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/configBackup` path allows you to get configuration backup of the backup server.

200.description: Configuration backup settings have been updated.

post.description: The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/configBackup` path allows you to start configuration backup.

get.description: The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/sessions` path allows you to get an array of sessions performed on the backup server.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of sessions to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of sessions to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts sessions by one of the session parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: Sorts sessions in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any session parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: createdAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are created after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: createdBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are created before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: endedAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are finished after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: endedBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are finished before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session type.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session state.

parameters.name: resultFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session result.

parameters.name: jobIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by job ID.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/vmware/fcd/{mountId}/migrate` path allows you to start migration of FCDs from the specified mount.
In the request body specify FCD migration configuration:
  • Disks for migration
  • Target datastore

For details on how to get models of the datastore and storage policy, see [Get VMware vSphere Server Objects](#tag/Inventory-Browser/operation/GetVmwareHostObject).

BadRequest.description: Bad request. This error is related to POST/PUT requests. The request body is malformed, incomplete or otherwise invalid.

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized. The authorization header has been expected but not found (or found but is expired).

Forbidden.description: Forbidden. The user sending the request does not have adequate privileges to access one or more objects specified in the request.

NotFound.description: Not found. No object was found with the path parameter specified in the request.

InternalServerError.description: Internal server error. The request has been received but could not be completed because of an internal error at the server side.

serverTime.description: Current date and time on the backup server.

timeZone.description: Time zone where the backup server is located.

name.description: Full DNS name or IP address of the backup server.

patches.description: Array of Veeam Backup & Replication cumulative patches installed on the backup server.

errorCode.description: The error code is a string that uniquely identifies an error condition and should be understood by programs that detect and handle errors by type

message.description: The error message contains a generic description of the error condition in English. It is intended for a human audience

resourceId.description: ID of the object that is involved in the error (or empty)

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return.

creationTime.description: Date and time when the session was created.

endTime.description: Date and time when the session was ended.

message.description: Message that explains the session result.

isCanceled.description: If *true*, the session has been canceled.

status.description: Status of the operation described by the log record.

startTime.description: Date and time when the operation was started.

updateTime.description: Date and time when the log record was updated.

validFrom.description: Date and time the certificate is valid from.

validBy.description: Expiration date and time of the certificate.

code.description: String that is used to obtain an access token. Lifetime of the authorization code is 60 seconds.

username.description: User name. Required if the `grant_type` value is `password`.

password.description: Password. Required if the `grant_type` value is `password`.

refresh_token.description: Refresh token. Required if the `grant_type` value is `refresh_token`.

code.description: Authorization code. Required if the `grant_type` value is `authorization_code`.

use_short_term_refresh.description: If *true*, a short-term refresh token is used. Lifetime of the short-term refresh token is the access token lifetime plus 15 minutes.

vbr_token.description: Veeam Backup & Replication platform service token.

ELoginGrantType.description:
Authorization grant type.
Available values:
  • `password` — used to obtain an access token by providing a user name and password.
  • `refresh_token` — used to refresh an expired or lost access token by providing a refresh token.
  • `authorization_code` — used to obtain an access token by providing an authorization code.
  • `vbr_token` — used to obtain an access token by providing a Veeam Backup & Replication token. This grant type is only used in a restricted mode for integration with Veeam Backup & Replication.

access_token.description: String that represents authorization issued to the client. It must be specified in all requests. An access token can be used multiple times, but its lifetime is 15 minutes.

refresh_token.description: String that is used to obtain a new access token if the current access token expires or becomes lost. A refresh token can be used only once, and its default lifetime is 14 days.

expires_in.description: Lifetime of the access token, in seconds.

.issued.description: Date and time when the access token is issued.

.expires.description: Date and time when the access token expires.

serverName.description: Full DNS name or IP address of the server.

credentialsId.description: ID of a credentials record used to connect to the server.

port.description: Port used to communicate with the server.

name.description: Full DNS name or IP address of the server.

credentialsId.description: ID of a credentials record used to connect to the server.

name.description: Full DNS name or IP address of the server.

credentialsId.description: ID of the credentials used to connect to the server.

WindowsHostPortsModel.description: Veeam Backup & Replication components installed on the server and ports used by the components.

components.description: Array of Veeam Backup & Replication components.

portRangeStart.description: Start port used for data transfer.

portRangeEnd.description: End port used for data transfer.

serverThisSide.description: If *true*, the server is run on this side.

WindowsHostComponentPortModel.description: Ports used by Veeam Backup & Replication components.

sshFingerprint.description: SSH key fingerprint used to verify the server identity. For details on how to get the fingerprint, see [Request TLS Certificate or SSH Fingerprint](#tag/Connection/operation/GetConnectionCertificate).

repositoryIds.description: Array of repository IDs added as scale-out backup repository extents.

fingerprint.description: SSH key fingerprint used to verify the server identity.

powerUp.description: If *true*, Veeam Backup & Replication starts the restored VM on the target host.

EntireViVMOriginalLocationRestoreSpec.description: Restore to the original location with initial settings.

quickRollback.description: If *true*, Veeam Backup & Replication performs incremental restore.

EntireViVMCustomizedRestoreSpec.description: Restore to a new location or with different settings. To get models of the destination host and resource pool, use the [Get VMware vSphere Server Objects](#tag/Inventory-Browser/operation/GetVmwareHostObject) request.

RestoreProxySpec.description: Backup proxies for VM data transport.

autoSelection.description: If *true*, Veeam Backup & Replication detects backup proxies that are connected to the source datastore and automatically assigns optimal proxy resources for processing VM data.

enableAntivirusScan.description: If *true*, Veeam Backup & Replication scans machine data with antivirus software before restoring the machine to the production environment.

enableEntireVolumeScan.description: If *true*, the antivirus continues machine scan after the first malware is found.

EVirusDetectionAction.description: Action that Veeam Backup & Replication takes if the antivirus software finds a threat.

EDiskCreationMode.description: Disk format of the restored VM.

restoreVmTags.description: If *true*, Veeam Backup & Replication restores tags that were assigned to the original VMs, and assigns them to the restored VMs.

RestoreTargetNetworkSpec.description: Network to which the restored VM is connected.

disconnected.description: If *true*, the restored VMs is not connected to any virtual network.

VmTagsRestoreEnabled.description: If *true*, Veeam Backup & Replication restores tags that were assigned to the original VM, and assign them to the restored VM.

nicsEnabled.description: If *true*, the restored VM is connected to the network.

powerUp.description: If *true*, Veeam Backup & Replication starts the restored VM on the target host.

InstantViVMOriginalLocationRecoverySpec.description: Instant Recovery to the original location with initial settings.

InstantViVMCustomizedRecoverySpec.description: Instant Recovery to a new location or with different settings.

overwrite.description: If *true*, Veeam Backup & Replication overwrites the existing VM that has the same name.

InstantViVMCustomizedRecoveryDestination.description: Destination where the recovered VM resides. To get models of the destination host, folder and resource pool, use the [Get VMware vSphere Server Objects](#tag/Inventory-Browser/operation/GetVmwareHostObject) request.

EInstantViVmRecoveryBiosUuidPolicyType.description: BIOS UUID policy for the restored VM.

InstantViVMCustomizedRecoveryDatastoreSp.description: Datastore that keeps redo logs with changes that take place while a VM is running from a backup.

redirectIsEnabled.description: If *true*, redo logs are redirected to `cacheDatastore`.

sessionId.description: ID of the restore session. Use the ID to track the progress. For details, see [Get Session](#tag/Sessions/operation/GetSession).

limit.description: Maximum number of mounts to return.

orderAsc.description: Sorts mounts in the ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

nameFilter.description: Filters mounts by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any mount parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

EInstantViVMRecoveryMountsFiltersOrderCo.description: Sorts mounts by one of the mount parameters.

VeeamQMEnabled.description: If *true*, the Veeam Quick Migration mechanism is used. Otherwise, Veeam Backup & Replication will use VMware vMotion for migration.

DeleteSourceVmsFiles.description: If *true*, Veeam Backup & Replication will delete source VM files upon successful migration.

backupIds.description: Array of backup IDs whose data you want to restore with the recovery token.

expirationDate.description: Date and time when the access token expires.

name.description: Friendly name of the recovery token.

expirationDate.description: Date and time when the recovery token expires.

expirationTime.description: Expiration date and time of the verification code. By default, the code is valid for 15 minutes.

applicationId.description: Client ID assigned to the Azure Active Directory application.

secret.description: Client secret assigned to the Azure Active Directory application.

tenantId.description: ID of a tenant where the Azure Active Directory application is registered in.

apiVersionParam.name: x-api-version
apiVersionParam.description: Version and revision of the client REST API. Must be in the following format: `<version>-<revision>`.

Bearer.description: Access token specified in the following format: `Bearer <access token>`.
Bearer.name: Authorization
